title: How to Play Hacky Sack in a Group

steps.headline: Don't apologize when you mess up.
Don't "gank" the hacky-sack from other members.
steps.description: Ganking is when another member is in the process of kicking the hacky-sack and someone steals it from them in mid-kick.

steps.headline: Treat it like any social-group, try to keep up with the rest.
Stay focused on the hack so you don't miss a beat.
steps.description: You'll look pretty stupid when the hack is laying 5 inches (12.7 cm) in front of your feet.

steps.headline: If you are very advanced in the sport, don't become a "hog".
steps.description: Which is somebody who continues on for a while showing off their moves. Nobody likes a hog.

steps.headline: Take it easy with both compliments and insults.
steps.description: When you are new to a circle, get a feel for the mood before you start flapping your mouth.

steps.headline: If the hack lands outside the circle, check to see if you're the closest to it.
steps.description: If you are, go and get it, regardless of who kicked it last. Note that this procedure varies depending on the dynamic of the group. In some groups, members will say "not it", and the last person to say this will be forced to get the hack, regardless of their place in the circle.

steps.headline: Practice!
steps.description: The game will go slowly and be more embarrassing for you if you drop the hack every time it's passed to you.

steps.headline: If you're new to hacky-sack, pay attention to other members' actions.

text: Never self-serve.  Don't apologize when you mess up.  Don't "gank" the hacky-sack from other members. Ganking is when another member is in the process of kicking the hacky-sack and someone steals it from them in mid-kick. Don't show off excessively.  Treat it like any social-group, try to keep up with the rest.  Stay focused on the hack so you don't miss a beat. You'll look pretty stupid when the hack is laying 5 inches (12.7 cm) in front of your feet. If you are very advanced in the sport, don't become a "hog". Which is somebody who continues on for a while showing off their moves. Nobody likes a hog. Take it easy with both compliments and insults. When you are new to a circle, get a feel for the mood before you start flapping your mouth. If the hack lands outside the circle, check to see if you're the closest to it. If you are, go and get it, regardless of who kicked it last. Note that this procedure varies depending on the dynamic of the group. In some groups, members will say "not it", and the last person to say this will be forced to get the hack, regardless of their place in the circle. Practice! The game will go slowly and be more embarrassing for you if you drop the hack every time it's passed to you. If you're new to hacky-sack, pay attention to other members' actions.  Have fun and stay relaxed.
